books.title: Candida
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A clergyman’s beliefs about his respectable household are challenged by a young poet who is in love with his wife.

books.title: The Three Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A group of recently-pardoned former vigilantes aids Scotland Yard in bringing a gang of thugs and murderers to justice.

books.title: Twenty Years at Hull House
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams’ autobiographical account of the founding and operation of Hull House, one of America’s most famous settlement homes.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Magic City
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A young boy, upset by his older sister’s recent marriage, builds an imaginary city out of blocks and household items and then finds himself living inside it.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Uncle Vanya
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: An elderly professor and his young wife return to their country estate, where their family’s simmering resentments boil over.

books.title: Kai Lung’s Golden Hours
books.author: Ernest Bramah
books.summary: An ancient Chinese storyteller charged with treason uses his beguiling tales to avoid conviction.

books.title: Howards End
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: The lives of three families of different classes intertwine in Edwardian England.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: The Bolshevik Myth
books.author: Alexander Berkman
books.summary: A left-wing radical records his experiences in revolutionary Russia.

books.title: The Bellamy Trial
books.author: Frances Noyes Hart
books.summary: A man and a woman are on trial for the murder of his wife, her friend.

books.title: Leviathan
books.author: Thomas Hobbes
books.summary: Hobbes explores a vision of the ideal state, in which people cede certain freedoms to a sovereign power in exchange for security and stability.

books.title: A Voyage to Arcturus
books.author: David Lindsay
books.summary: One man’s journey through a psychedelic alien landscape of philosophy, religion, life, and death.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Wilfred Owen
books.summary: A collection of Wilfred Owen’s published poems.

books.title: Martin Eden
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A young working-class man sets out to become a bourgeois writer.

books.title: Search the Sky
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A man visits several worlds as he attempts to discover why humanity is dying out.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A collection of Fritz Leiber short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Pursuit of God
books.author: A. W. Tozer
books.summary: A. W. Tozer’s classic work on Christian living, containing practical advice for those who wish to know God, not simply know about Him.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.
